sentences.english: Billions of young people want to move beyond the shackles of poverty and conflict.
sentences.chinese: 數十億年輕人想擺脫貧困和衝突的鐐銬。

sentences.english: Power is the shackle to shackle itself while love is the emancipator to emancipate itself.
sentences.chinese: 權勢是禁錮自己的鐐銬，愛情是解放自己的救星。

sentences.english: The criminals were paraded in chains through the crowded streets.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯帶着鐐銬被押着列隊遊街示衆。

sentences.english: Heavy iron chains around his feet and hands were fixed to a metal bar that ran round the hall about ten centimetres off the ground.
sentences.chinese: 銬着他的腳和手的沉重的鐐銬被固定在一條鐵欄杆上。

sentences.english: Some thieves have eaten off their irons with mercury water.
sentences.chinese: 有些竊賊用汞水腐蝕他們的鐐銬。

sentences.english: It is forever breaking the bonds that confine you to a single location.
sentences.chinese: 真正的解放是打破束縛讓你永遠待在一個地方的鐐銬。

sentences.english: This allows us to move unfettered, full steam ahead.
sentences.chinese: 這讓我們能夠掙脫鐐銬，全速前進。

sentences.english: He regarded his first and only son as a fetter .
sentences.chinese: 不，他認爲這兒子是繫縛他的鐐銬。

sentences.english: And streams and rivers freed from irons of ice.
sentences.chinese: 溪澗和河川掙開了冰結的鐐銬。

definition: see 眾星捧月|众星捧月[zhong4 xing1 peng3 yue4]
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
